borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
description:
Construction of a part two storey part single storey rear extension, construction of a single storey front extension and the construction of a rear dormer extension including two roof lights to the front to facilitate the conversion of roof space into
habitable accommodation
decision_conditions: <p style="">The proposed development by reason of its siting, scale, massing, bulk, design&nbsp;would introduce a discordant feature and therefore would fail to make a positive contribution to the&nbsp;character and appearance of the dwellinghouse, the terrace, and wider area.&nbsp;In addition, the proposed development represents an overdevelopment of the site. The proposed extension when taken into consideration&nbsp;with the other extensions on site would be&nbsp;disproportionate to the size of the application property. The proposal is therefore contrary to:</p><ul style=""><li style="">Paragraphs 131, 135, 139, and 209&nbsp;of the National Planning Policy Framework (December&nbsp;2023)</li><li style="">Policies D4, D6 and HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021)</li><li style="">Policies CP2 and CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</li><li style="">Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</li><li style="">Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li><li style="">Paragraph 5.3.3(c and d) of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</li></ul>

<p style="">The proposed development by reason of its sitting, depth, scale, massing, and bulk would negatively affect daylight, sunlight, and it would create overbearing towards neighbours living at Numbers 88and&nbsp;92 Beccles Drive,&nbsp;<span style="font-size:11pt"> Barking, Barking And Dagenham, IG11 9HY</span>.&nbsp;The proposal is therefore contrary to:<br></p><p style=""></p><ul style=""><li style="">Paragraph 135(f) of the National Planning Policy Framework (December&nbsp;2023)</li><li style="">Policies D6 of the London Plan (March 2021)</li><li style="">Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</li><li style="">Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li><li style="">Figure 3 and Paragraph 5.3.3(b) of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</li></ul>
